page.title: 07A Village Family
page.content: The Lindars family have lived in Tetsworth for more than 300 years. We spoke to Mr.Lindars who has lived in the village for all his 82 years.He was one of twelve children, but such large families were not uncommon in his day. (The largest village family today has six children.)Mr.Lindars used to live in two cottages, one is now the Art Gallery but the other was pulled down. He estimated that a dozen or so cottages have been demolished in the last few years. He used to travel as far as Reading by horse, but usually walked everywhere. His father kept an allotment and chickens to supplement his farm worker's wage. Mr. Lindars went to our school and told us how the teachers used a wheelbarrow to get the children out of school when it flooded. He left school at 11 and went to work on a farm and later at the car factory.
